meanings.definition: The voice box in humans and other mammals, containing the vocal cords.
meanings.sent1: Her larynges helped her sing beautifully.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the larynges to understand how we speak.
meanings.sent3: The larynges of the opera singer were the envy of all.
meanings.sent4: His larynges were like finely tuned instruments, producing melodious sounds.
meanings.sent5: The larynges of the choir harmonized perfectly, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.definition: The upper part of the respiratory tract in humans and other mammals, containing the vocal cords.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined her larynges to check for any issues.
meanings.sent2: Coughing can sometimes strain the larynges.
meanings.sent3: The larynges of the patient seemed to have a mind of their own, causing unexpected sounds.
meanings.sent4: In the cold weather, the larynges can feel dry and scratchy.
meanings.sent5: She felt a tickle in her larynges, making her clear her throat repeatedly.
